## One-High Threshold Model ~ results

```{r fig.width = 4.5, fig.height = 3.5, fig.align='center', message=FALSE, results = 'hide', echo=FALSE, jags}
library(rjags)

data <- list(
  hits    = c( 8, 9,14,14,13, 8,13,12,11, 4, 8,13,15,12,11, 9, 5, 5, 6,15,11,14,12,12,11, 1,14,13, 7,11,12, 8,11),
  fas     = c( 4, 4, 0, 1, 2, 0, 3, 1, 3, 0, 0, 1, 0, 0, 0, 0, 1, 0, 3, 0, 0, 1, 2, 1, 2, 0, 0, 0, 2, 1, 2, 0, 2),
  nPeople = 31,
  nOld    = 15, 
  nNew    = 15)

modelString = "
  # MPT Recognition
  # single high threshold
  model{
    for (i in 1:nPeople){
      hits[i] ~ dbin(thetaHit, nOld)
      fas[i]  ~ dbin(thetaFA , nNew)
    }
    thetaHit = rho + (1-rho)*gamma
    thetaFA  = gamma
    rho   ~ dunif(0, 1)
    gamma ~ dunif(0, 1)
  }
"
writeLines( modelString , con="mpt.txt") 
parameters <- c("gamma",  "rho")
jagsModel = jags.model( file="mpt.txt", data=data, n.chains=3, n.adapt=1000) 
set.seed(0)
update(jagsModel, n.iter=1000)
samples = coda.samples(jagsModel, variable.names=parameters, n.iter=10000)

plot(samples)
```

## One-High Threshold Model ~ summary statistics
```{r, echo=TRUE, summary}

summary(samples)$statistics

summary(samples)$quantiles
```

## One-High Threshold Model ~ convergence
```{r, echo=TRUE, convergence}

effectiveSize(samples)

gelman.diag(samples)
```
